Climate resilience - flood mitigation. Improved in-stream morphology and bed stabilitzation can provide bank stability - therefore inproved streambank and shoreline condition. Direct benefits to populations will increase biodiversity. Reduced erosion and sedimentation will improve water quality. Providing nesting areas for water birds and islands for migrating water fowl improves ecosystem connectivity along migration routes.

Ability to distribute grazing pressure will reduce compaction and erosion to soils. Reducing disturbance to Riparian corridors and improving AOP provides ecosystem connectivity in terrestrial and aquatic habitat.
Combined with associated conservation practices such as wetland ehnancement or AOP, can conserve wetlands, provide wetland habitat, and provide ecosystem connectivity.

CP Name: CP #395 | Stream Habitat Improvement and Management  | (Acres)
Notes: Reconnecting floodplains to streams will improve water availability during drought by allowing floodwater storage within floodplain wetlands to be slowly released during drought conditions. Terrestrial habitat will benefit through improvements to riparian habitat and streambank conditions.

Providing grade control can also provide access to upstream areas for fish and wildlife previously blocked due to headcutting issues. Water quantity will improve by reducing downcutting - whch effectively lowers the water table.
Biodiversity of grassland/herbaceous habitats will improve.
Opportunities for income from recreational opportunities. Reduced erosion when combined with other practices.

Creating wetlands will support increased biodiversity. Connectivity will imcrease between wetlands for wetland-dependent amphibians, reptiles, and migratory birds. Wetlands are carbon sinks. Temporary flood storage provided and downstream flooding risks reduced. Water stored in wetlands provides slow release during drought conditions.

Notes: Recreational opportunities for landowner after loss of cropland. Improved connectivity between fragmented habitats. Reduced emissions due to retirement of cropland.
